alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 5:20AM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 1000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches are expected, with higher amounts over 2 feet above 3000 feet in elevation. Winds gust as high as 45 mph this morning on mountain ridgetops and highway passes with near blizzard conditions possible for a few hours on Monday. Light snow accumulation may occur as low as 500 feet in elevation late tonight and Tuesday morning. * WHERE...Northern Trinity and Southern Trinity Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
